newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-FRENCH COMEBACK SINKS ENGLISH GRAND SLAM HOPES.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-FRENCH COMEBACK SINKS ENGLISH GRAND SLAM HOPES.

text.p: France produced an astonishing fightback to edge out England 23-20 at Twickenham on Saturday and set up the prospect of their first Five Nations grand slam for 10 years.

In windy conditions England led 20-6 with 18 minutes left before a tremendous French onslaught yielded converted tries for winger Laurent Leflamand and centre Christophe Lamaison which levelled the scores.
Lamaison, who scored 18 points in all, then landed the decisive penalty four minutes from time to settle the outcome and complete the first French win at Twickenham for a decade.

France now simply have to beat Scotland at home to clinch the title. England, with a vastly superior points difference, still have a chance if they can beat Wales and the French slip up in a fortnight's time.
